conversation.text: Hi. I'm Bob. Shall we cook some Artichoke Hearts?
Yes. What should I do?
First you need to preheat your oven and prepare a baking sheet. Is your oven turned on?
evidence: Preheat your oven to 400 °F (204 °C) and line a baking sheet.

conversation.text: Just turned it on.
While the oven is heating up, we can prepare the artichoke hearts. Do you have a sharp knife to cut them?
evidence: Cut the artichoke hearts in half and place them in a bowl to season them

conversation.text: Yes, I do. Is there any requirement on cutting them?
Just cutting them in half is good and placing them in a bowl to add oil and any seasonings you might like.
What seasonings do you recommend?
Pepper and garlic is good. Parmesan cheese adds great flavour. Do you have any?
evidence: For a savory flavor, try sprinkling the artichoke hearts with grated parmesan cheese.

conversation.text: Yes, I do.
Is it already grated?
Just did that. And I have added the seasonings.
Good. Is your oven up to temperature?
Yes, it's 400 F now.
Ok, time to roast the artichokes. Please place them cut side down on your tray.
Cool! I'm ready.
Now we can bake them. It takes about 30 minutes total and you should turn them over after about 15 minutes.
evidence: Bake them for about 15 minutes and then turn them over

conversation.text: I have baked them on both sides. Can I take them out of the oven?
Yes. You can now eat them with a bit more olive oil if you want or use them in something else. Did you prepare them to eat now?
evidence: Serve the roasted artichoke hearts hot or add them to other recipes

conversation.text: I don't want to eat now - need to cook something else.
Alright. Is there anything else I can help you with?
No, that's all. Thanks!
I hope you enjoy them. Have a great day. Goodbye.

procedure.summary: Preheat your oven to 400 °F (204 °C) and line a baking sheet.
procedure.description: If you know that your oven cooks warmer or cooler, then adjust the temperature as necessary based on your experiences. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. If you don't have parchment paper, that's okay—there will just be more clean up later.

procedure.summary: Cut the artichoke hearts in half and place them in a bowl to season them.
procedure.description: Drizzle olive oil over the artichoke hearts. Season the artichokes based on your taste preferences. Many people choose spices such as thyme, salt, pepper, and garlic, but feel free to experiment here. For a savory flavor, try sprinkling the artichoke hearts with grated parmesan cheese.

Lay the artichokes, cut-side down, on a baking sheet and put them in the oven. Bake them for about 15 minutes and then turn them over. Continue baking for about 15 more minutes or until the artichokes turn golden brown. Some ovens vary in temperature, so keep an eye on the artichokes and adjust the cooking time as needed. When they are golden brown, they are ready to eat!

procedure.summary: Serve the roasted artichoke hearts hot or add them to other recipes.
procedure.description: You can drizzle a little more olive oil over the top before serving, or try them on pizza, salad, or in your favorite pasta recipe. Store any leftover roasted artichoke hearts in an airtight container in the refrigerator for 3-5 days.
